result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell J Kallas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
1:24 P.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - no longer wants an attorney.  DA recites offer, upon plea to both counts will dismiss the repeater and request probation.  Defendant concurs.  No objection to the court denying the request for court appointed counsel.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to both counts.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  (EACH)  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS: (BOTH)

Court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent

Court dismisses the repeater.

Court adjourned at 1:32 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Mitchell J Kallas
Current: 416 Oak Street Apt 3, Ripon, WI 54971 United States  (Effective: 05-08-2015)
Prior: 312 W. Water Street, Princeton, WI 54968 United States

1:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has received a petition for court appointed attorney.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Court instructs the defendant to talk with 2 attorneys and if he can afford one.  Court will ask who and how much at next court date.  Court sets for status hearing on May 18, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 4, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
